intro: Cryptandra recurva, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, often twisted stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow or greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by insects. Cryptandra recurva is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
